data.text:
Quentin Tarantino wrote and directed the Oscar nominee and winner for Django Unchained. This film won the academy award for best supporting actor and best original and best original screenplay. Tarantino is known for his “unpredictable violent films and first gained fame for his movie Pulp Fiction” (Biography). The movie Django Unchained takes place two years before the Civil War a slave name Django finds himself traveling with an unorthodox German bounty hunter Dr. King Schultz. The relationship between the two develop into a deep friendship. Through the analysis of their relationship throughout their journey will displayed concepts of: Forming relationships, deception and conflict. During the dinner the butler can tell that Django and Broomhilda knew each other by the way they were looking at each other. As the butler takes Candi to the side and tells them that this was all a lie to be able to get the girl this is when the conflict arises. Interpersonal conflict is an expressed struggle between interdependent parties who perceive incompatible goals, scarce resources, and interference from one another (Floyd 343). Coercive power is power that derives from the ability to punish (Floyd 360). When Calvin Candie finds out that Schultz and Django lied about not wanting to buy a fighter for 12,000 but to take this slave he becomes furious. When he comes back to the table he uses his coercive power and his body guard to threaten them that if they lift their hands off the table he will have his guard kill them both and the girl. They then somehow manage to compromise into the original agreement of paying 12,000 and will give Broomhilda freedom.
